div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 258px; height: 1px; padding-top: 150px; margin-left: 161px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 13px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Internal AMM Price & Oracle Price are the same or almost the same.
The soft-liquidation engine starts to offer very small discounts for trading
Borrowers should only lose slight amounts, or even in some cases make money if the trading fee is larger than the discount offered.

switch.text: Internal AMM Price & Oracle Price are th...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 258px; height: 1px; padding-top: 330px; margin-left: 161px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 13px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Internal AMM Price & Oracle Price are a little different
The system starts swapping collateral by offering a small discount to anyone trading.
Losses in these periods are small, gas prices are low, so MEV bots rebalance as it's profitable to do so.

switch.text: Internal AMM Price & Oracle Price are a...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 258px; height: 1px; padding-top: 510px; margin-left: 161px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 13px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Internal AMM Price & Oracle Price have a big difference
The system starts swapping collateral by offering large discounts to anyone trading. This only happens in times of high volatility, with high gas prices, so discounts need to be large for MEV bots to rebalance collateral. This causes large losses for borrowers.

switch.text: Internal AMM Price & Oracle Price have a...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 128px; height: 1px; padding-top: 30px; margin-left: 11px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 18px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; font-weight: bold; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 258px; height: 1px; padding-top: 30px; margin-left: 161px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 18px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; font-weight: bold; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 128px; height: 1px; padding-top: 150px; margin-left: 11px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 14px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: Low volatility periods: prices move up and down very slowly and smoothly

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 128px; height: 1px; padding-top: 330px; margin-left: 11px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 14px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: Moderate volatility periods: prices move up and down at a noticeable pace, with some quick movements but without extreme jumps

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 128px; height: 1px; padding-top: 510px; margin-left: 11px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 14px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: High volatility periods: prices move up and very quickly, prices can jump huge amounts in a few seconds

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 238px; height: 1px; padding-top: 15px; margin-left: 441px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 18px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; font-weight: bold; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 250px; height: 1px; padding-top: 150px; margin-left: 435px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
ETH Price moves slowly down, Curve has users in Soft-liquidation and needs to swap small amounts of ETH for crvUSD. It offers ETH for sale at a very small discount, which makes it the best DEX price available.
The discount offered is less than the trading fees fee earned on the deposited collateral, so when users swap on DEXs the borrowers actually make collateral and profit.

switch.text: ETH Price moves slowly down, Curve has use...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 238px; height: 1px; padding-top: 40px; margin-left: 441px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: All examples are using ETH as collateral to borrow crvUSD

switch.text: All examples are using ETH as collateral...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 238px; height: 1px; padding-top: 330px; margin-left: 441px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
ETH price moves down and no swappers have taken advantage of the discount.
An MEV bot realises they can make a little money by buying ETH cheap from the SL Engine and selling it elsewhere. So the bot rebalances the collateral, and the borrowers incur a small loss.

switch.text: ETH price moves down and no swappers hav...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 238px; height: 1px; padding-top: 510px; margin-left: 441px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
ETH Price moves down very quickly. Gas prices are high. The discount offered by the SL Engine becomes large enough to offset the gas prices and make it profitable for MEV bots to quickly rebalance the collateral.
MEV bots rebalance, but borrowers incur a reasonable loss from the discount the engine had to offer.

switch.text: ETH Price moves down very quickly. Gas...
